meanings.definition: Of or relating to the transmission of genetic characteristics from a parent to offspring.
meanings.sent1: The telegonic traits passed down from my mother made me resemble her.
meanings.sent2: The telegonic connection between the siblings was evident in their shared features.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the telegonic resemblance between the puppy and its parent.
meanings.sent4: The telegonic influence of the father's genes was strong in the child's appearance.
meanings.sent5: The telegonic bond between generations was undeniable in the family's traits.

meanings.definition: Having a distant or remote ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The telegonic lineage of the royal family could be traced back centuries.
meanings.sent2: The telegonic connection to historical figures fascinated the young historian.
meanings.sent3: It was surprising to discover a telegonic link to a famous explorer in the family tree.
meanings.sent4: The telegonic heritage of the ancient artifact added to its mystique.
meanings.sent5: The telegonic roots of the tradition were deeply embedded in the community.
